Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sequential Interventions for Posttransplant Lymphoproliferative Disease in Adult Solid Organ Transplant Recipients

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Participants.evidence: adult solid organ transplant recipients with biopsy-proven PTLD

Intervention.evidence: RI involved a 50% reduction in cyclosporine or tacrolimus for 2 weeks, with a further 50% reduction for 1 week if complete remission (CR) was not achieved.

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial assessed a sequential treatment algorithm for posttransplant lymphoproliferative disease (PTLD) in adult solid organ transplant recipients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was CR, measured over the treatment course.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: RI resulted in 1 partial response (12.5%) and no CR. Progressive disease occurred in 50% and rejection in 38%.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
